passages.text: GS Asia Macao: Global Market Recap - USA: Court Rules Against Tariffs But Leaves Them in Place Pending Supreme Court Review / Global Economics Comment: Technical Updates to Our Global CAIs
高盛亚洲宏观：全球市场回顾－美国：法院裁定关税无效，但在最高法院审查期间维持关税不变／全球经济评论：对我们全球CAI的技术更新

Prepared by a Goldman Sachs Global Banking & Markets Division, which may have a position in the products mentioned that is inconsistent with the views expressed in this material. In evaluating this material, you should know that it could have been previously provided to other clients and/or internal Goldman Sachs personnel, who could have already acted on it. The views or ideas expressed here are those of the desk and/or author only and are no an official view of Goldman Sachs; others at Goldman Sachs may have opinions or may express views that are contrary to those herein. This material is not independent advice and is not a product of Global Investment Research. This material is a solicitation of derivatives business generally, only for the purposes of, and to the extent it would otherwise be subject to, CFTC Regulations 1.71 and 23.605. Past performance is not an indicator of future results. Goldman Sachs provides no assurance that future results will be consistent with the projected analysis.

由高盛全球银行与市场部编制，该部门可能在所提及的产品中持有与本资料所表达观点不一致的头寸。在评估本资料时，您应知悉其可能已事先提供给其他客户和/或高盛内部人员，他们可能已据此采取行动。此处表达的观点或想法仅代表交易台和/或作者个人观点，并非高盛的官方立场；高盛的其他人员可能持有与此相反的意见或观点。本资料并非独立建议，亦非全球投资研究部的产品。本资料为衍生品业务的一般性推介，仅在适用且受美国商品期货交易委员会（CFTC）法规1.71和23.605约束的范围内使用。过往业绩并不代表未来结果。高盛不保证未来结果会与预测分析一致。

trading desk may have a position in the financial products discussed below from time to time, and holds such a position at this time. All references to "we/us/our" refer to GS FICC & Equities Division unless specified.
交易部门可能会不时在下文讨论的金融产品中持有头寸，并且目前确实持有此类头寸。除非另有说明，所有提及“我们/我方/我们的”均指 GS FICC & Equities Division.

- USTs – UST futures drifted lower on Monday led by the long end in the absence of cash markets (closed for Labor Day holiday). Bunds and Gilts bear steepened ahead of a heavy supply schedule, although found some support from manufacturing PMI's. ECB Lagarde said loss of Fed independence would pose “a very serious threat to the US economy and the global economy”. Data begins this week with
ISM manufacturing due.
美国国债（USTs）——在现金市场因劳动节假期休市的情况下，美国国债期货周一在长端带动下走低。德国国债（Bunds）和英国国债（Gilts）在大量供给预期下出现熊市陡峭化走势，不过制造业PMI数据提供了一定支撑。欧洲央行行长拉加德表示，美联储失去独立性将对“美国经济和全球经济构成非常严重的威胁”。本周数据将从ISM制造业数据开始公布。

- Bunds – In Europe, bonds cheapeyed across the complex in a quiet session with the US on holiday. Bunds closed 3.6bps cheaper while 2s10s closed “1.5bps steeper. Oats underperformed 0.3bps after French Prime Minister Francois Bayrou struck a combative tone in his effort to gain support for a Sept. 8 confidence vote, while acknowledging that talks with political parties may fail to save his government from being ousted. In the periphery, Italy announced supply (new 7y and new 30y benchmarks (15/11/2032 and 01/10/2055). The BTP/Bund spread closed unch.

德国国债（Bunds）——在欧洲，由于美国休市，市场交投清淡，债券整体走弱。德国国债收盘下跌3.6个基点，2年- 10年期限利差收盘陡峭约1.5个基点。法国国债（OATs）表现落后0.3个基点，此前法国总理弗朗索瓦·贝鲁在争取9月8日信任投票支持的过程中采取了强硬立场，同时承认与各政党的谈判可能无法挽救其政府免于被罢免。在外围市场，意大利宣布发行新7年期和新30年期基准债券（到期日分别为2032年11月15日和2055年10月1日）。BTP/德国国债利差收盘持平。

- Gilts – In the UK Gilts sold off “3bps with 30yr yields hitting a new high of 5.64%. UK PM Sir Keir Starmer announced changes to his team to reset his government and give him more influence over economic policy. Darren Jones was appointed to a new role as chief secretary to the PM to lead day-to-day operations in his office, and will be replaced by James Murray as chief secretary to the Treasury. Starmer also appointed former deputy governor at the BoE Shafik as his new chief economic adviser, a move that is seen as undermining Rachel Reeves's authority. Both appointees are expected to heavily involved in shaping the taxation and spending decisions the Chancellor will unveil this autumn (date yet to be announced). Nationwide house prices unexpectedly fell 0.1% in August (consensus +0.1%), yoy +2.1% (consensus 2.7%) a slight decline from the 2.4% annual growth rate recorded the month before. UK August manufacturing PMI declined to 47 (consensus 47.3). Consumer credit rose to £1.62bn (consensus £1.35bn), whilst mortgage approvals came in at 65,352 (the most in 6 months), compared with the revised 64,571 in the prior month. UK services PMI due Wednesday and the delayed July retail sales data due on Friday. DMO sells new 10yr October 2035 Gilt via syndication on Tuesday (estimate £12bn), and GBP800mln 0.625% 2045 I/L Gilts on Thursday.

英国国债——英国国债下跌约3个基点，30年期收益率创下5.64%的新高。英国首相基尔·斯塔默爵士宣布调整其团队，以重塑政府并增强其对经济政策的影响力。达伦·琼斯被任命为首相办公室的新任首席秘书，负责领导日常运作，其财政部首席秘书职位将由詹姆斯·穆雷接任。斯塔默还任命英国央行前副行长沙菲克为其新任首席经济顾问，此举被视为削弱雷切尔·里夫斯权威的举动。预计这两位任命人选将深度参与制定财政大臣将在今年秋季公布的税收和支出决策（具体日期尚未公布）。Nationwide数据显示，英国8月房价意外下跌0.1%（市场预期+0.1%），同比上涨2.1%（市场预期2.7%），较上月2.4%的年增速略有回落。英国8月制造业PMI降至47（市场预期47.3）。消费者信贷上升至162亿英镑（市场预期135亿英镑），而抵押贷款批准数量为65,352笔（为6个月来最高），高于上月修正后的64,571笔。英国服务业PMI将于周三公布，推迟的7月零售销售数据将于周五公布。英国债务管理办公室（DMO）将于周二通过联合承销方式发行新的2035年10月到期的10年期国债（预计发行额为120亿英镑），并于周四发行8亿英镑的0.625%2045年到期指数挂钩国债。

- JGBs – JGBs started slightly weaker after the month-end extension, and the 20-25yr sector led further selling, reacting to its month-end outperformance. Futures also sold off throughout the day, possibly due to the expectation for BoJ cash settlement of 6\~8yr bonds at the beginning of the month and the upcoming 10yr auction. On the other hand, the 25yr+ sector was firm, possibly due to switching buying, and the ultra-long curve bear flattened. As a result, the 30-40yr sector outperformed on the curve, while the 20-25yr sector underperformed. Ahead of the 10yr auction, the sector has seen continued robust dip-buying demand above 1.6% amid a gradual rise in rates, and the tight repo rates suggest that there is a certain degree of short positions in the market. However, valuations on the curve are expensive, and dealers' risk appetite is low, so the concession appears to be somewhat insufficient.

Short- covering by short- term players was noticeable during the market sell- off. Absolute interest rates are around the recent high, so robust investor demand, mainly from bank type accounts, can be expected. However, pensions' rebalancing demand is not expected to be very large, and expectations of further rates sell- off remain strong, so demand from short- term players is also expected to be limited.

日本国债——在月末延长期结束后日本国债开盘略显疲软，20- 25年期板块领跌，回吐了月末的超额表现。期货全天也出现抛售，可能是由于市场预期日本央行将在月初对6\~8年期债券进行现金结算，以及即将到来的10年期国债招标另一方面，25年以上期限板块表现坚挺，可能受益于换仓买盘，超长期收益率曲线出现熊市趋势。因此，30- 40年期板块在曲线上表现优于大盘，而20- 25年期板块表现不佳。在10年期国债招标前，该板块在收益率逐步上升、利率高于 \(1.6\%\) 的情况下，持续受到强劲的逢低买盘支撑，而紧张的回购利率表明市场中存在一定程度的空头仓位。然而，曲线估值偏高，交易商的风险偏好较低，因此让利似乎略显不足。在市场抛售期间，短期交易者的回补空头行为较为明显。绝对利率接近近期高位，因此预计主要来自银行类账户的投资者需求将保持强劲。然而，养老金的再平衡需求预计不会很大，且市场对利率进一步抛售的预期依然强烈，因此短期投资者的需求也预计将受到限制。

- AUD-During London, Sep and Nov RBA were better bid while the local session saw better paying from FM. Issuance remains in focus with sizable ACGB supply (300, 34s, 1bn 36s, 900m 31s), a new Green'36 bond from QTC (pricing today) and an RBC 6NC5 benchmark.
澳元- 伦敦时段，9月和11月RBA买盘较好，而本地交易时段则有来自FM的更多买入。发行仍是市场关注焦点，ACGB供应量可观（300、34s、10亿36s、9亿31s），昆士兰财政公司（QTC）将发行新的2036年绿色债券（今日定价），以及RBC6NC5基准债券。

- Equities - U.S equity futures posted small gains after the federal appeals court ruled Trump's global tariffs were illegal. Cash markets were closed for Labor Day. EU equities closed small higher in a relatively calm back to school day with Europe closing in the green (SXXP +20bps, SX5E +30bps) on a thin tape as US markets were closed for Labour Day (SXXP volumes -30% vs 20d avg). Price action was lacklustre with pretty much all sectors trading within a +/- 1s.d. range, making Defense (GSSBDEFE +3%) the only real standout. whilst Asian equities were mixed (HSI +2%, Nikkei -1%).

股票- 美国股指期货在联邦上诉法院裁定特朗普的全球关税非法后小幅上涨。因劳动节假期，现货市场休市。欧洲股市在相对平静的“开学日”小幅收高，收盘全线飘红（SXXP +20个基点，SX5E +30个基点），成交清淡，因为美国市场因劳动节休市（SXXP成交量较20日均值下降30%）。价格走势乏善可陈，几乎所有板块都在正负1个标准差的区间内波动，国防板块（GSSBDEFE +3%）成为唯一的亮点。亚洲股市表现不一（恒生指数 +2%，日经指数 - 1%）。

1/ USA: Court Rules Against Tariffs But Leaves Them in Place Pending Supreme Court Review - The Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit (CAFC) largely affirmed the Court of International Trade's (CIT) May ruling blocking President Trump's tariffs imposed under the International Economic Emergency Powers Act (IEEPA). These tariffs account for 8pp of the increase in the effective tariff rate to date. The CAFC delayed the effect of its ruling until Oct. 14 or, assuming the Trump administration appeals the ruling, whenever the Supreme Court either declines to review the case or issues a judgement. If the Supreme Court agrees to review the case, this could leave the tariffs in place until as late as June 2026. Legal uncertainty could lead the Trump administration to shift tariffs to other statutory bases but, however the Supreme Court ultimately rules, the president will retain substantial authority to impose tariffs.

1/ 美国：法院裁定关税无效但在最高法院审查前暂时保留——美国联邦巡回上诉法院（CAFC）基本维持了国际贸易法院（CIT）5月的裁决，即阻止特朗普总统依据《国际经济紧急状态权力法》（IEEPA）征收的关税。这些关税迄今为止占有效关税率上升的8个百分点。CAFC将其裁决的生效时间推迟至10月14日，或者如果特朗普政府提出上诉，则推迟至最高法院拒绝审理此案或作出判决之日。如果最高法院同意审理此案，关税可能会一直保留至最晚2026年6月。法律上的不确定性可能促使特朗普政府将关税转移至其他法律依据，但无论最高法院最终如何裁决，总统仍将保留相当大的关税征收权力。
https://marquee.gs.com/content/research/en/reports/2025/09/01/5fe8fc326- 3239- 481- a6cf- 2daecce806c4. html

2/ Global Economics Comment: Technical Updates to Our Global CAIs - We are making three technical changes to our CAIs. First, several inputs have been discontinued since our last update in 2020. For affected economies, we find a substitute (if available) and re- estimate the weights that determine each indicator's contribution to the overall growth signal. Second, we harmonize (across the economies) the pandemic- affected months from 2020- 2021 that we exclude when estimating the relationship between the CAI's activity signal and GDP. Third, for several economies we update our estimates of the relationship between business surveys and GDP that we use to capture nonlinearities. For most economies these changes lead to modest revisions, and our historical global, DM, and EM CAIs are essentially unchanged. And for economies where revisions are visible, they generally lead to an increase in the correlation with historical GDP. We therefore see these changes as a modest improvement to our global CAIs.

2/ 全球经济评论：全球 CAI 的技术更新——我们对 CAI 进行了三项技术调整。首先，自 2020 年上次更新以来，部分输入数据已被停用。对于受影响的经济体，我们会寻找替代数据（如有），并重新估算决定各指标对整体增长信号贡献的权重。其次，我们统一了（跨经济体）在估算 CAI 活动信号与 GDP 关系时所排除的 2020- 2021 年受疫情影响的月份。第三，对于部分经济体，我们更新了用于捕捉非线性关系的商业调查与 GDP 之间关系的估算。对于大多数经济体，这些变化仅带来温和的修正，我们的历史全球、发达市场（DM）和新兴市场（EM） CAI 基本保持不变。而对于修正较明显的经济体，这些变化通常会提高与历史 GDP 的相关性。因此，我们认为这些调整对全球 CAI 是一次温和的改进。
https://marquee.gs.com/content/research/en/reports/2025/09/01/c9f2e7f7- 324f- 4544- 82c4- 4de4eacd7420. html

OTC Derivatives Risk Disclosures:

Terms of the Transaction: To understand clearly the terms and conditions of any OTC derivative transaction you may enter into, you should carefully review the Master Agreement, including any related schedules, credit support documents, addenda and exhibits. You should not enter into OTC derivative transactions unless you understand the terms of the transaction you are entering into as well as the nature and extent of your risk exposure. You should also be satisfied that the OTC derivative transaction is appropriate for you in light of your circumstances and financial condition. You may be requested to post margin or collateral to support written OTC derivatives at levels consistent with the internal policies of Goldman Sachs.
交易条款：为清楚了解您可能参与的任何场外衍生品交易的条款和条件，您应仔细审阅《主协议》，包括任何相关的附表、信用支持文件、附录和附件。在未理解所参与的场外衍生品交易条款以及您所面临的风险性质和程度之前，您不应进行此类交易。您还应确保该场外衍生品交易在您的具体情况和财务状况下是适合的。您可能会被要求按照高盛的内部政策，在与已签署的场外衍生品相符的水平上提供保证金或抵押品。

Liquidity Risk: There is no public market for OTC derivative transactions and, therefore, it may be difficult or impossible to liquidate an existing position on favorable terms. Transfer Restrictions: OTC derivative transactions entered into with one or more affiliates of The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. (Goldman Sachs) cannot be assigned or otherwise transferred without its prior written consent and, therefore, it may be impossible for you to transfer any OTC derivative transaction to a third party.
流动性风险：场外衍生品交易没有公开市场，因此可能很难或无法在有利条件下平仓现有头寸。转让限制：与高盛集团有限公司（Goldman Sachs）一个或多个关联方进行的场外衍生品交易，未经其事先书面同意，不得转让或以其他方式转移，因此，您可能无法将任何场外衍生品交易转让给第三方。

Conflict of Interests: Goldman Sachs may from time to time be an active participant on both sides of the market for the underlying securities, commodities, futures, options or any other derivative or instrument identical or related to those mentioned herein (together, "the Product"). Goldman Sachs at any time may have long or short positions in, or buy and sell Products (on a principal basis or otherwise) identical or related to those mentioned herein. Goldman Sachs hedging and trading activities may affect the value of the Products.
利益冲突：高盛可能会不时在标的证券、商品、期货、期权或与此处提及的相同或相关的任何其他衍生品或工具（统称为“产品”）的市场中同时活跃于买卖双方。高盛可能在任何时候持有与此处提及的相同或相关的产品的多头或空头头寸，或买入和卖出这些产品（无论是以自营方式还是其他方式）。高盛的对冲和交易活动可能会影响产品的价值。

Counterparty Credit Risk: Because Goldman Sachs, may be obligated to make substantial payments to you as a condition of an OTC derivative transaction, you must evaluate the credit risk of doing business with Goldman Sachs or its affiliates.
交易对手信用风险：由于高盛可能在场外衍生品交易中有义务向您支付大量款项，您必须评估与高盛或其关联公司进行交易的信用风险。

Pricing and Valuation: The price of each OTC derivative transaction is individually negotiated between Goldman Sachs and each counterparty and Goldman Sachs does not represent or warrant that the prices for which it offers OTC derivative transactions are the best prices available, possibly making it difficult for you to establish what is a fair price for a particular OTC derivative transaction; The value or quoted price of the Product at any time, however, will reflect many factors and cannot be predicted. If Goldman Sachs makes a market in the offered Product, the price quoted by Goldman Sachs would reflect any changes in market conditions and other relevant factors, and the quoted price (and the value of the Product that Goldman Sachs will use for account statements or otherwise) could be higher or lower than the original price, and may be higher or lower than the value of the Product as determined by reference to pricing models used by Goldman Sachs. If at any time a third party dealer quotes a price to purchase the Product or otherwise values the Product, that price may be significantly different (higher or lower) than any price quoted by Goldman Sachs. Furthermore, if you sell the Product, you will likely be charged a commission for secondary market transactions, or the price will likely reflect a dealer discount. Goldman Sachs may conduct market making activities in the Product. To the extent Goldman Sachs makes a market, any price quoted for the OTC derivative transactions, Goldman Sachs may differ significantly from (i) their value determined by reference to Goldman Sachs pricing models and (ii) any price quoted by a third party. The market price of the OTC derivative transaction may be influenced by many unpredictable factors, including economic conditions, the creditworthiness of Goldman Sachs, the value of any underlyers, and certain actions taken by Goldman Sachs.

定价与估值：每笔场外衍生品交易的价格均由高盛与各交易对手单独协商确定，高盛不声明或保证其提供的场外衍生品交易价格是市场上可获得的最佳价格，这可能会使您难以判断某一特定场外衍生品交易的公允价格。然而，产品在任何时间的价值或报价将反映多种因素，且无法预测。如果高盛为所提供的产品做市，高盛所报的价格将反映市场状况的任何变化及其他相关因素，该报价（以及高盛用于账户报表或其他用途的产品价值）可能高于或低于原始价格，并且可能高于或低于根据高盛所使用的定价模型确定的产品价值。如果在任何时候第三方交易商报出购买该产品的价格或以其他方式对该产品进行估值，该价格可能与高盛报出的任何价格存在显著差异（无论高于或低于）。此外，如果您出售该产品，您可能会因二级市场交易被收取佣金，或者价格可能会反映经销商折扣。高盛可能会在该产品中进行做市活动。在高盛进行做市的情况下，高盛为场外衍生品交易所报的任何价格，可能与（i）依据高盛定价模型确定的价值以及（ii）第三方所报的任何价格存在显著差异。场外衍生品交易的市场价格可能会受到许多不可预测因素的影响，包括经济状况、高盛的信用状况、任何相关标的的价值，以及高盛采取的某些行动。

Market Making, Investing and Lending: Goldman Sachs engages in market making, investing and lending businesses for its own account and the accounts of its affiliates in the same or similar instruments underlying OTC derivative transactions (including such trading as Goldman Sachs deems appropriate in its sole discretion to hedge its market risk in any OTC derivative transaction whether between Goldman Sachs and you or with third parties) and such trading may affect the value of an OTC derivative transaction.
做市、投资与借贷：高盛为自身账户及其关联方账户从事做市、投资和借贷业务，这些业务涉及与场外衍生品交易所依据的相同或类似工具（包括高盛自行全权决定为对冲其在任何场外衍生品交易中的市场风险而进行的交易，无论该交易是高盛与您之间还是与第三方进行），此类交易可能会影响场外衍生品交易的价值。

Early Termination Payments: The provisions of an OTC Derivative Transaction may allow for early termination and, in such cases, either you or Goldman Sachs may be required to make a potentially significant termination payment depending upon whether the OTC Derivative Transaction is in- the- money to Goldman Sachs or you at the time of termination. Indexes:

Terms of the Transaction: To understand clearly the terms and conditions of any OTC derivative transaction you may enter into, you should carefully review the Master Agreement, including any related schedules, credit support documents, addenda and exhibits. You should not enter into OTC derivative transactions unless you understand the terms of the transaction you are entering into as well as the nature and extent of your risk exposure. You should also be satisfied that the OTC derivative transaction is appropriate for you in light of your circumstances and financial condition. You may be requested to post margin or collateral to support written OTC derivatives at levels consistent with the internal policies of Goldman Sachs.

Liquidity Risk: There is no public market for OTC derivative transactions and, therefore, it may be difficult or impossible to liquidate an existing position on favorable terms. Transfer Restrictions: OTC derivative transactions entered into with one or more affiliates of The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. (Goldman Sachs) cannot be assigned or otherwise transferred without its prior written consent and, therefore, it may be impossible for you to transfer any OTC derivative transaction to a third party.

Conflict of Interests: Goldman Sachs may from time to time be an active participant on both sides of the market for the underlying securities, commodities, futures, options or any other derivative or instrument identical or related to those mentioned herein (together, "the Product"). Goldman Sachs at any time may have long or short positions in, or buy and sell Products (on a principal basis or otherwise) identical or related to those mentioned herein. Goldman Sachs hedging and trading activities may affect the value of the Products.

Counterparty Credit Risk: Because Goldman Sachs, may be obligated to make substantial payments to you as a condition of an OTC derivative transaction, you must evaluate the credit risk of doing business with Goldman Sachs or its affiliates.

Pricing and Valuation: The price of each OTC derivative transaction is individually negotiated between Goldman Sachs and each counterparty and Goldman Sachs does not represent or warrant that the prices for which it offers OTC derivative transactions are the best prices available, possibly making it difficult for you to establish what is a fair price for a particular OTC derivative transaction; The value or quoted price of the Product at any time, however, will reflect many factors and cannot be predicted. If Goldman Sachs makes a market in the offered Product, the price quoted by Goldman Sachs would reflect any changes in market conditions and other relevant factors, and the quoted price (and the value of the Product that Goldman Sachs will use for account statements or otherwise) could be higher or lower than the original price, and may be higher or lower than the value of the Product as determined by reference to pricing models used by Goldman Sachs. If at any time a third party dealer quotes a price to purchase the Product or otherwise values the Product, that price may be significantly different (higher or lower) than any price quoted by Goldman Sachs. Furthermore, if you sell the Product, you will likely be charged a commission for secondary market transactions, or the price will likely reflect a dealer discount. Goldman Sachs may conduct market making activities in the Product. To the extent Goldman Sachs makes a market, any price quoted for the OTC derivative transactions, Goldman Sachs may differ significantly from (i) their value determined by reference to Goldman Sachs pricing models and (ii) any price quoted by a third party. The market price of the OTC derivative transaction may be influenced by many unpredictable factors, including economic conditions, the creditworthiness of Goldman Sachs, the value of any underlyers, and certain actions taken by Goldman Sachs.

Market Making, Investing and Lending: Goldman Sachs engages in market making, investing and lending businesses for its own account and the accounts of its affiliates in the same or similar instruments underlying OTC derivative transactions (including such trading as Goldman Sachs deems appropriate in its sole discretion to hedge its market risk in any OTC derivative transaction whether between Goldman Sachs and you or with third parties) and such trading may affect the value of an OTC derivative transaction.

Early Termination Payments: The provisions of an OTC Derivative Transaction may allow for early termination and, in such cases, either you or Goldman Sachs may be required to make a potentially significant termination payment depending upon whether the OTC Derivative

Transaction is in the money to Goldman Sachs or you at the time of termination. Indexes: Goldman Sachs does not warrant, and takes no responsibility for, the structure, method of computation or publication of any currency exchange rates, interest rates, indexes of such rates, or credit, equity or other indexes, unless Goldman Sachs specifically advises you otherwise.

• GSALLC is regulated by the Hong Kong Securities and Futures Commission under Hong Kong laws; and
• GSSP is regulated by the Monetary Authority of Singapore under Singapore laws.
